indicators.name: Context
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate and act sustainably in a range of varied and specific contexts involving creative and nonroutine activities; transfer and apply theoretical concepts and/or technical or creative skills to a range of contexts

indicators.name: Role
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate and Exercise substantial personal autonomy and often take responsibility for the work of others and/or for the allocation of resources; form, and function within, multiple, complex and heterogeneous groups

indicators.name: Learning to Learn
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate and learn to evaluate own learning and identify needs within a structured learning environment; assist others in identifying learning needs

indicators.name: Insight
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate and express an internalised, personal world view, manifesting engagement with others

indicators.name: Range
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate a comprehensive range of specialised skills and tools

indicators.name: Selectivity
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate formulate responses and determine sustainable solutions to well-defined abstract problems

indicators.name: Breadth
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate specialised knowledge of a broad area

indicators.name: Kind
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate some theoretical concepts and abstract thinking with significant underpinning theory

indicators.name: Context
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate and act sustainably and utilise diagnostic and creative skills in a range of functions in a wide variety of contexts

indicators.name: Role
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate and Accept accountability for determining and achieving personal and/ or group outcomes; take significant or supervisory responsibility for the work of others in defined areas of work

indicators.name: Learning to Learn
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate and take initiative to identify and address learning needs and interact effectively in a learning group

indicators.name: Insight
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate and express an internalised, personal world view, manifesting solidarity with others

indicators.name: Range
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate specialised technical, creative or conceptual skills and tools across an area of study

indicators.name: Selectivity
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate exercise appropriate judgement in planning, design, technical and/ or supervisory functions related to products, services, operations or processes with sustainability in mind

indicators.name: Breadth
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate specialised knowledge across a variety of areas

indicators.name: Kind
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate recognition of limitationsof current knowledge and familiarity with sources of new knowledge; integration of concepts across a variety of areas

indicators.name: Context
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate and act sustainably and use advanced skills to conduct research including research analysis, or advanced technical or professional activity, accepting accountabilities for all related decision making; transfer and apply diagnostic and creative skills in a range of contexts

indicators.name: Role
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate and Act effectively under guidance in a peer relationship with qualified practitioners; lead multiple, complex and heterogeneous groups

indicators.name: Learning to Learn
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate and learn to act in variable and unfamiliar learning contexts; learn to manage learning tasks independently, professionally and ethically

indicators.name: Insight
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate and express a comprehensive, internalised, personal world view, manifesting solidarity with others

indicators.name: Range
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate mastery of a complex and specialised area of skills and tools; use and modify advanced skills and tools to conduct closely guided research, professional or advanced technical activity

indicators.name: Selectivity
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate exercise appropriate judgement in a number of complex planning, design, technical and/or management functions related to products, services, operations or processes, including resources with sustainability in mind

indicators.name: Breadth
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate an understanding of the theory, concepts and methods pertaining to a field (or fields) of learning

indicators.name: Kind
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate detailed knowledge and understanding in one or more specialised areas, some of it at the current boundaries of knowledge

indicators.name: Context
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate and act sustainably in a wide and often unpredictable variety of professional levels and ill-defined contexts

indicators.name: Role
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate and Take significant responsibility for the work of individuals and groups; lead and initiate activity

indicators.name: Learning to Learn
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate and learn to self-evaluate and take responsibility for continuing academic/professional development

indicators.name: Insight
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate and scrutinise and reflect on social norms and relationships and act to change them

indicators.name: Range
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate a range of standard and specialised research or equivalent tools and techniques of enquiry

indicators.name: Selectivity
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate select from complex and advanced skills across a field of learning; develop new skills to a high level, including novel and emerging techniques with sustainability in mind

indicators.name: Breadth
indicators.descriptor: The graduate should be able to demonstrate a systematic understanding of knowledge, at, or informed by, the forefront of a field of learning

indicators.descriptorText: Knowledge of the context for professional practice (including regulatory, economic, scientific, technological, social and cultural aspects) and of significant issues at the interfaces with related disciplines and professions

indicators.descriptorText:
Knowledge of the wider context for practice in the profession including critical awareness
and anticipation of the fundamental issues for the profession and at the interfaces with other disciplines and professions

indicators.name: Learning to learn
indicators.descriptor: Learn to act in variable and unfamiliar learning contexts; learn to manage learning tasks independently, professionally and ethically
indicators.descriptorText: Select from a broad range of specialised skills and tools and apply them to problems arising in professional activity; problems here are usually predictable but are subject to change

indicators.name: Insight
indicators.descriptor: Express a comprehensive, internalised, personal world view manifesting solidarity with others
indicators.descriptorText: Select from a comprehensive range of specialised skills and tools and apply them to the generation of creative solutions to problems arising in professional activity

indicators.name: Range
indicators.descriptor: Demonstrate mastery of a complex and specialised area of skills and tools; use and modify advanced skills and tools to conduct closely guided research, professional or advanced technical activity
indicators.descriptorText:
Knowledge of the context for professional activity (familiarity with the community
of practice and with safety, employment, technological and regulatory perspectives and with relevant economic, social and environmental issues) and awareness of other disciplines likely to be encountered as a member of the community of practice

indicators.descriptor: Exercise appropriate judgement in a number of complex planning, design, technical and/ or management functions related to products, services, operations or processes, including resourcing
indicators.descriptorText: Knowledge of the context for professional practice (including regulatory, economic, scientific, technological, social and cultural aspects) and awareness of other disciplines likely to be encountered as a practitioner and member of the profession

indicators.name: Breadth
indicators.descriptor: An understanding of the theory, concepts and methods pertaining to a field (or fields) of learning
indicators.descriptorText: Comprehensive and critical evaluation of current developments and trends in the relevant professional or academic literature and as the basis for research or innovation and strategic change and leadership

Knowledge of the context for professional activity (familiarity with the community
of practice and with safety, employment, technological and regulatory perspectives) and awareness of disciplines likely to be encountered as a member of the community of practice

indicators.descriptor: Use advanced skills to conduct research, or advanced technical or professional activity, accepting accountability for all related decision making; transfer and apply diagnostic and creative skills in a range of contexts
indicators.descriptorText: Practical understanding of facts, concepts, rules, regulations, methods, materials, tools, devices, techniques; their development and limitations; and how they are applied in current occupational activity

indicators.name: Role
indicators.descriptor: Act effectively under guidance in a peer relationship with qualified practitioners; lead multiple, complex and heterogeneous groups
indicators.descriptorText: Practical understanding of facts, concepts, rules, regulations, abstract models, methods, materials, tools, devices, technologies; their development and limitations; and how they are applied in current occupational activity

indicators.name: Learning to learn
indicators.descriptor: Learn to act in variable and unfamiliar learning contexts; learn to manage learning tasks independently, professionally and ethically
indicators.descriptorText: Understanding of facts, concepts, rules, models, schools of thought, methods, technology; their development and limitations; and how they arise and are applied in current professional practice

indicators.name: Insight
indicators.descriptor: Express a comprehensive, internalised, personal world view manifesting solidarity with others
indicators.descriptorText: Critical understanding of facts, concepts, rules, models,  schools of thought, methods, technology; their development and limitations; and how they arise and are applied in current professional practice

indicators.name: Range
indicators.descriptor: Demonstrate mastery of a complex and specialised area of skills and tools; use and modify advanced skills and tools to conduct closely guided research, professional or advanced technical activity
indicators.descriptorText: Broad and up-to-date general knowledge and specialised knowledge of a variety of areas comprising a professional discipline and of the connections between these areas and with related disciplines; to include knowledge about recent developments and trends in the professional discipline or its practice

indicators.name: Selectivity
indicators.descriptor: Exercise appropriate judgement in a number of complex planning, design, technical and/ or management functions related to products, services, operations or processes, including resourcing
indicators.descriptorText: Broad and up-to-date general knowledge and specialised knowledge of a variety of areas comprising a professional discipline and of the connections between these areas and related disciplines; to include knowledge about recent developments and trends in the professional discipline or its practice;

indicators.name: Breadth
indicators.descriptor: An understanding of the theory, concepts and methods pertaining to a field (or fields) of learning
indicators.descriptorText:
Broad current general knowledge and an integrated body of specialised knowledge required to support a craft or an occupational discipline and knowledge of the connections with related disciplines;
Specialised knowledge here involves significant underpinning theory and an awareness of the boundaries of that knowledge

indicators.name: Kind
indicators.descriptor: Detailed knowledge and understanding in one or more specialised areas, some of it at the current boundaries of the field(s)
indicators.descriptorText: Broad and up-to-date general knowledge and specialised knowledge of a variety of areas comprising a professional discipline and of the connections between these areas and with related disciplines

indicators.name: Context
indicators.descriptor: Act in a wide and often unpredictable variety of professional levels and ill defined contexts
indicators.descriptorText: Plan and develop investigative strategies and evaluate information to determine creative, evidence-informed solutions to predictable and unpredictable  problems and respond to unpredictable change arising in professional activity that take due account of social, field-specific and ethical insights

indicators.name: Role
indicators.descriptor: Take significant responsibility for the work of individuals and groups; lead and initiate activity
indicators.descriptorText: Prepare evidence-based conclusions that take due account of social, disciplinary and ethical insights

indicators.name: Learning to learn
indicators.descriptor: Learn to self-evaluate and take responsibility for continuing academic/professional development
indicators.descriptorText: Prepare and analyse evidence-based conclusions that take due account of social, disciplinary and ethical insights

indicators.name: Insight
indicators.descriptor: Scrutinise and reflect on social norms and relationships and act to change them
indicators.descriptorText: Prepare and evaluate evidence-based conclusions that take due account of social, disciplinary and ethical insights.

indicators.name: Range
indicators.descriptor: Demonstrate a range of standard and specialised research or equivalent tools and techniques of enquiry
indicators.descriptorText: Select, modify and apply advanced skills, including research or innovation skills,  to critically analyse, research independently and formulate responses to unpredictable, complex and ill-defined problems with many interacting factors, in order to develop new knowledge or procedures and integrate knowledge from other disciplines

indicators.name: Selectivity
indicators.descriptor: Select from complex and advanced skills across a field of learning; develop new skills to a high level, including novel and emerging techniques
indicators.descriptorText: Evaluate and use information to draw conclusions and determine solutions to predictable problems arising in professional activity that take due account of social, field-specific and ethical insights

indicators.name: Breadth
indicators.descriptor: A systematic understanding of knowledge at, or informed by, the forefront of a field of learning
indicators.descriptorText: Select and apply advanced skills to analyse and respond to unpredictable and complex problems arising in the profession and its reflective practice.

indicators.name: Kind
indicators.descriptor: A critical awareness of current problems and/or new insights, generally informed by the forefront of a field of learning
indicators.descriptorText: Select, modify and apply advanced skills to critically analyse, research (under close guidance)  and formulate responses to unpredictable, complex and  ill-defined problems arising in  the profession and its reflective professional practice

indicators.descriptor: Exercise appropriate judgement in planning, design, technical and/or supervisory functions related to products, services, operations or processes

indicators.descriptor: Recognition of limitations of current knowledge and familiarity with sources of new knowledge; integration of concepts across a variety of areas

indicators.name: Context
indicators.descriptor: Act in a wide and often unpredictable variety of professional levels and ill defined contexts
indicators.descriptorText: Communicate complex information effectively, transfer one’s knowledge and skills, and justify recommendations and research findings, to specialists and non-specialists, including clients; influence and lead professional practice

indicators.descriptor: Take significant responsibility for the work of individuals and groups; lead and initiate activity

indicators.descriptor: Demonstrate a range of standard and specialised research or equivalent tools and techniques of enquiry
indicators.descriptorText: Communicate information effectively, transfer one’s knowledge and skills, and justify decisions, to specialists and non-specialists, including clients

indicators.descriptorText: Communicate advanced information, transfer one’s knowledge and skills, and justify decisions, to specialists and non-specialists, including clients

of practice; justify decisions, to specialists and non-specialists, including clients

indicatorGroups.name: Competence – Context, role, learning-to-learn and insight

indicators.name: Exercising autonomy and judgement
indicators.descriptor: Exercise autonomy and judgement in applying knowledge and skills in a variety of contexts including professional practice and learning

indicators.name: Exercising responsibility
indicators.descriptor: Exercise initiative and independence in professional activity, taking responsibility for the nature and quality of outputs and for decisions in work and learning contexts

indicators.name: Working with others
indicators.descriptor:
Act effectively in team roles within multiple, complex and heterogeneous groups
Exercise supervision in contexts of work or learning activities
Lead a variety of occupational activities
Contribute to the review and development of the performance of others;
Take some responsibility for the evaluation and improvement of work or learning activities

indicators.name: Learning and teaching
Attitudes
indicators.descriptor: Express an internalised, personal world view, reflecting engagement with others at the personal, occupational, societal, and environmental levels

indicators.name: Knowledge scope and coherence
indicators.descriptor:
Broad current general knowledge and an integrated body of specialised knowledge required to support a craft or an occupational discipline and knowledge of the connections with related disciplines;
Specialised knowledge here involves significant underpinning theory and an awareness of the boundaries of that knowledge
indicators.descriptorText: Exercise autonomy and judgement in applying knowledge and skills in a wide variety of complex contexts including professional practice and study,

indicators.name: Knowledge structure
indicators.descriptor: Practical understanding of facts, concepts, rules, regulations, abstract models, methods, materials, tools, devices, technologies; their development and limitations; and how they are applied in current occupational activity
indicators.descriptorText: Manage complex technical or professional activities or projects, taking responsibility for decision-making and decisions in unpredictable work or study contexts

Knowledge of the context for professional activity (familiarity with the community
of practice and with safety, employment, technological and regulatory perspectives and with relevant economic, social and environmental issues) and awareness of other disciplines likely to be encountered as a member of the community of practice
indicators.descriptorText:
Act effectively in team roles within multiple, complex and heterogeneous groups

indicatorGroups.name: Skill and know-how – range and selectivity

indicators.name: Use cognitive and practical skills (analytical and synthetic) to solve problems
indicators.descriptor: Select from a comprehensive range of specialised skills and tools and apply them to the generation of creative solutions to problems arising in professional activity

indicators.name: Draw insightful conclusions
indicators.descriptor: Plan and develop investigative strategies and evaluate information to determine creative, evidence-informed solutions to predictable and unpredictable  problems and respond to unpredictable change arising in professional activity that take due account of social, field-specific and ethical insights
indicators.descriptorText: Evaluate learning needs of self and others and take responsibility for continuing academic/ professional development of same;

indicators.name: Communicate and influence
indicators.descriptor:
Communicate complex oral and written information effectively in familiar and unfamiliar contexts; facilitate  the transfer of knowledge and skills within the professional community
of practice; justify decisions, to specialists and non-specialists, including clients
indicators.descriptorText:
Express a comprehensive internalised, personal and professional world-view, manifesting solidarity with others at all levels including
the personal, professional, societal and environmental

indicators.descriptor: Manage complex technical or professional activities or projects, taking responsibility for decision-making and decisions in unpredictable work or study contexts

indicators.descriptor: Act effectively in team roles  and take responsibility for managing individuals and groups

indicators.name: Learning and teaching
indicators.descriptor: Take initiative to identify and address learning needs;  seek necessary guidance when working independently

indicators.descriptorText: Exercise autonomy and judgement in applying knowledge and skills in a wide variety of complex contexts, including professional practice and study, and transfer them to unfamiliar and emerging contexts

indicators.descriptorText:
Manage complex and innovative technical or professional activities or projects, taking
responsibility for decision-making and decisions in unpredictable and unfamiliar work or study contexts, balancing responsibilities towards service-users and employer,

indicators.descriptorText: Act effectively in team roles  and take responsibility for managing individuals and groups

indicators.descriptorText: Express an internalised, personal world view, reflecting engagement with others at the personal, occupational, societal, and environmental levels

indicators.name: Communicate and influence
indicators.descriptor: Communicate advanced information, transfer one’s knowledge and skills, and justify decisions, to specialists and non-specialists, including clients

indicatorGroups.name: Competence – Context, role, learning-to-learn and insight

indicators.name: Exercising autonomy and judgement
indicators.descriptor: Exercise autonomy and judgement in applying knowledge and skills in a wide variety of complex contexts, including professional practice and study, and transfer them to unfamiliar and emerging contexts

indicators.name: Exercising responsibility
indicators.descriptor: Manage and transform work or study contexts that are complex, unpredictable and require new strategic approaches; take responsibility for decisions and contributing to professional knowledge and practice

indicators.name: Working with others
indicators.descriptor: Act effectively in team roles and take responsibility for managing individuals and lead complex and heterogeneous groups and for reviewing the strategic performance of teams

indicators.name: Learning and teaching
indicators.descriptor: Evaluate learning needs of self and others and take responsibility for continuing academic/ professional development of same;

indicators.name: Attitudes
indicators.descriptor: Scrutinise and reflect on social and professional norms and relationships and act to change them in the interests of professional standards,  society or the wider environment

indicators.name: Knowledge scope and coherence
indicators.descriptor: Broad and up-to-date general knowledge and specialised knowledge of a variety of areas comprising a professional discipline and of the connections between these areas and related disciplines; to include knowledge about recent developments and trends in the professional discipline or its practice;
indicators.descriptorText: Exercise initiative and independence in professional activity, taking responsibility for the nature and quality of outputs and for decisions in work and learning contexts

indicators.name: Knowledge structure
indicators.descriptor: Comprehensive and critical evaluation of current developments and trends in the relevant professional or academic literature and as the basis for research or innovation and strategic change and leadership
indicators.descriptorText:
Act effectively in team roles within multiple, complex and heterogeneous groups
Assist in the supervision of routine work or learning activities
Take responsibility for leading on some occupational activities
Contribute to the review and development of the performance of others

indicators.name: Knowledge of issues
indicators.descriptor:
Knowledge of the wider context for practice in the profession including critical awareness
and anticipation of the fundamental issues for the profession and at the interfaces with other disciplines and professions
indicators.descriptorText: Act effectively in team roles and take responsibility for managing individuals and lead complex and heterogeneous groups and for reviewing the strategic performance of teams

indicatorGroups.name: Skill and know-how – range and selectivity

indicators.name: Use cognitive and practical skills (analytical and synthetic) to solve problems
indicators.descriptor: Select, modify and apply advanced skills, including research or innovation skills,  to critically analyse, research independently and formulate responses to unpredictable, complex and ill-defined problems with many interacting factors, in order to develop new knowledge or procedures and integrate knowledge from other disciplines
indicators.descriptorText: Manage learning tasks independently, professionally and ethically;  seek necessary guidance when working independently and provide guidance to peers

indicators.name: Draw insightful conclusions
indicators.descriptor: Prepare and evaluate evidence-based conclusions that take due account of social, disciplinary and ethical insights.
indicators.descriptorText: Express an internalised personal world-view (see Notes below) manifesting solidarity with others at all levels including the personal, professional, societal, and environmental

indicators.name: Communicate and influence
indicators.descriptor: Communicate complex information effectively, transfer one’s knowledge and skills, and justify recommendations and research findings, to specialists and non-specialists, including clients; influence and lead professional practice

indicators.name: Context
indicators.descriptor: Act in a range of varied and specific contexts involving creative and non-routine activities; transfer and apply theoretical concepts and/or technical or creative skills to a range of contexts

indicators.name: Role
indicators.descriptor: Exercise substantial personal autonomy and often take responsiblity for the work of others and/or for the allocation of resources; form, and function within, multiple, complex and heterogeneous groups

indicators.name: Learning to Learn
indicators.descriptor: Learn to evaluate own learning and identify needs within a structured learning environment; assist others in identifying learning needs

indicators.name: Insight
indicators.descriptor: Express an internalised, personal world view, reflecting engagement with others

indicators.name: Range
indicators.descriptor: Demonstrate comprehensive range of specialised skills and tools

indicators.name: Selectivity
indicators.descriptor: Formulate responses to well-defined abstract problems

indicators.name: Breadth
indicators.descriptor: Specialised knowledge of a broad area

indicators.name: Kind
indicators.descriptor: Some theoretical concepts and abstract thinking, with significant underpinning theory

indicators.name: Context
indicators.descriptor: Utilise diagnostic and creative skills in a range of functions in a wide variety of contexts

indicators.name: Role
indicators.descriptor: Accept accountability for determining and achieving personal and/ or group outcomes; take significant or supervisory responsibility for the work of others in defined areas of work

indicators.name: Learning to Learn
indicators.descriptor: Take initiative to identify and address learning needs and interact effectively in a learning group

indicators.name: Insight
indicators.descriptor: Express an internalised, personal world view, manifesting solidarity with others

indicators.name: Range
indicators.descriptor: Demonstrate specialised technical, creative or conceptual skills and tools across an area of study

indicators.name: Selectivity
indicators.descriptor: Exercise appropriate judgement in planning, design, technical and/ or supervisory functions related to products, services, operations or processes

indicators.name: Breadth
indicators.descriptor: Specialised knowledge across a variety of areas

indicators.name: Kind
indicators.descriptor: Recognition of limitations of current knowledge and familiarity with sources of new knowledge; integration of concepts across a variety of areas

indicators.name: Context
indicators.descriptor: Display mastery Use advanced skills to conduct research, or advanced technical or professional activity, accepting accountability for all related decision making; transfer and apply diagnostic and creative skills in a range of contexts

indicators.name: Role
indicators.descriptor: Act effectively under guidance in a peer relationship with qualified practitioners; lead multiple, complex and heterogeneous groups

indicators.name: Learning to Learn
indicators.descriptor: Learn to act in variable and unfamiliar learning contexts; learn to manage learning tasks independently, professionally and ethically

indicators.name: Insight
indicators.descriptor: Express a comprehensive, internalised, personal world view manifesting solidarity with others

indicators.name: Range
indicators.descriptor: Demonstrate mastery of a complex and specialised area of skills and tools; use and modify advanced skills and tools to conduct closely guided research, professional or advanced technical activity

indicators.name: Selectivity
indicators.descriptor: Exercise appropriate judgement in a number of complex planning, design, technical and/or management functions related to products, services, operations or processes, including resourcing

indicators.name: Breadth
indicators.descriptor: An understanding of the theory, concepts and methods pertaining to a field (or fields) of learning

indicators.name: Kind
indicators.descriptor: Detailed knowledge and understanding in one or more specialised areas, some of it at the current boundaries of the field(s)

indicators.name: Context
indicators.descriptor: Act in a wide and often unpredictable variety of professional levels and ill defined contexts

indicators.name: Role
indicators.descriptor: Take significant responsibility for the work of individuals and groups; lead and initiate activity

indicators.name: Learning to Learn
indicators.descriptor: Learn to self-evaluate and take responsibility for continuing academic/professional development

indicators.name: Insight
indicators.descriptor: Scrutinise and reflect on social norms and relationships and act to change them

indicators.name: Range
indicators.descriptor: Demonstrate a range of standard and specialised research or equivalent tools and techniques of enquiry

indicators.name: Selectivity
indicators.descriptor: Select from complex and advanced skills across a field of learning; develop new skills to a high level, including novel and emerging techniques

indicators.name: Breadth
indicators.descriptor: A systematic understanding of knowledge, at, or informed by, the forefront of a field of learning

indicators.name: Kind
indicators.descriptor: A critical awareness of current problems and/or new insights, generally informed by the forefront of a field of learning
